text: hello and welcome to community chats
i'm your host ali hammer and in this
series we will be hearing from 14
different aws leaders
each one discussing a different
leadership principle
for our very first guest we are so
thrilled to be joined with phil
davies our managing director for asia
pacific and japan
here at aws phil thank you so much for
being on the show
can you start by telling us about your
career and what attracted you to join
aws
well thanks ali and thanks uh everybody
for uh for joining us
it's uh great to be able to uh have this
little discussion
i'd say there were probably two key
things that attracted me to
aws first of all i was talking to a lot
of different customers
all around the globe and there were
certain themes that kept coming through
one was around this focus on agility
and flexibility a second one was a focus
on the need to
digitally transform and i was
extremely excited about joining aws
because i see aws really at the center
of helping customers be able to
transform
and become more agile and more flexible
i think the second thing that was really
attractive were the leadership
principles
you know as most people are aware we
have 14 leadership principles here
at amazon and they really resonated with
me and i felt it was a really really
good cultural fit
and so for those two reasons i was uh
excited to join the team
so phil what do you like about aws
culture and is there anything that you
find particularly unique or that has
actually surprised you since joining the
company
well like i mentioned i mean the
leadership principles were a strong
attraction for me to uh
to join and so overall i found that a
great
uh kind of connection um but in
particular i'd say there were probably
two things that really kind of uh
both resonated with me but also i think
were a little bit surprising
um number one was just the focus on
customers
you know jeff founded the company to be
the most customer
centric company on the planet and when
you're on the outside you hear those
things it's when you get in
you actually get to live that firsthand
and that's been
incredibly uh energizing to me
you know i've been at some other
companies where
you know you become very maybe
competitor compelled right you're too
focused on what's the competition doing
one of the things that really really is
clear here is if you're focused on doing
a better job
understanding your customers needs and
meeting those needs better than
anybody else on the planet you don't
need to worry so much about what the
competition is doing
so that was kind of one thing that
really resonated with me and that i
i thought was kind of unique the second
one
is the whole sense of ownership it's
again one of our leadership principles
um but when you behave like an owner
you're much more likely to think about
things in terms of the
long term um and make very balanced
decisions
once again having been at very large
public companies i can tell you
not every company is as focused on the
long term
there are a lot of other companies out
there that really focus on that 90-day
window for earnings and i find it very
refreshing and frankly very thrilling
to be a part of an organization that
thinks about things
for the uh the long term and instills
that sense of ownership
in all of the team members all around
the globe
it's so true i mean aws definitely has a
unique culture and particularly when it
does come to our customers
it has just been so great to hear your
thoughts about what customer obsession
really means here at aws
and we so appreciate your time today so
thank you so much phil for joining
us all right well thank you for having
me i enjoyed it very much
bye we'll see you next time thank you
